articles.author: Steve Holland, David Morgan
articles.description: It's a sweeping decision that could disrupt education and health care programs, housing assistance, disaster relief and a host of other initiatives that depend on billions of federal dollars.
articles.title: Trump orders pause to all federal grants and loans

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Residents in several neighbourhoods reported small arms fire and some loud explosions, particularly close to the airport.
articles.title: Rwanda-backed Congo rebels face pockets of resistance after entering Goma

articles.author: Mohammed Salem, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Three more Israeli hostages are due to be handed over on Thursday by Hamas, in exchange for scores of Palestinian prisoners set for release from Israeli jails.
articles.title: Palestinians return to Gaza City as mediators look ahead to next stage

articles.author: Gerry Doyle
articles.description: China appears to be building a large laser-ignited fusion research centre in the southwestern city of Mianyang, experts at two analytical organisations say, a development that could aid nuclear weapons design and work exploring power generation.
articles.title: Exclusive: Images show China building huge fusion research facility, analysts say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two Colombian air force planes carrying deportees from the United States arrived in Bogota on Tuesday, the government said, paving the way for U.S. President Donald Trump's administration to lift visa restrictions and other measures on Colombian citizens.
articles.title: Colombian planes carrying US deportees arrive in Bogota after Trump-Petro row

articles.author: Aleksandar Vasovic
articles.description: Serbian Prime Minister Milos Vucevic resigned on Tuesday, becoming the highest-ranking official to step down amid a wave of anti-corruption protests that have spread across the country.
articles.title: Serbian prime minister quits as anti-corruption protests persist

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: It would be the first legal challenge to a cornerstone of his conservative agenda at the Pentagon.
articles.title: Exclusive: Rights groups preparing to file lawsuit against Trump's transgender troops order, source says

articles.author: Sergiy Karazy, Yurii Kovalenko
articles.description: Six months ago, doctors were performing an operation at Ukraine's Center for Pediatric Cardiology and Cardiac Surgery when a missile struck the adjacent building inside the Kyiv compound of Ukraine's biggest children's hospital.
articles.title: Ukrainian doctors save lives at children's heart surgery center relocated after missile attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said on Tuesday she had been placed under judicial investigation over her country's surprise release of a Libyan police officer wanted by the International Criminal Court.
articles.title: Italy's Meloni under investigation over release of Libyan suspect

articles.author: Joe Bavier
articles.description: M23's last occupation of Goma was short-lived, and within a year they were a defeated force. This time, things are different.
articles.title: Congo fighting: Rwanda-backed M23's deja-vu rise harder to stop this time
